wikipedia_page.main: Arthur James Sherwell (11 April 1863 – 13 January 1942) was a British Liberal Party politician and temperance campaigner.

response: In 1899 Joseph Rowntree and Arthur Sherwell proposed that People's Houses should be built as part of a programme by the Temperance Party to provide "recreations of the simplest and least exacting kind, such as would specially appeal to those to whom the stress of their daily lives leaves little inclination for anything more than physical relaxation and cheerful intercourse":Stead, William Thomas. The Review of Reviews, January–June 1899: p. 392  that is, a viable alternative to the public house.

response: * Transcript of British 'Gothenburg' Experiments and Public-House Trusts by Joseph Rowntree and Arthur Sherwell (1903)
The local Liberal Association selected 43 year-old temperance campaigner Arthur Sherwell to defend the seat.
